龖龖龖

龖字的基本解释

龖
dá
双龙：“龖之赫，霆之砉。”
龙腾飞的样子。

龖字的汉语字典释义

[①]［dá］
［《廣韻》徒合切，入合，定。］
亦作“龘1”。
两条龙。

龖字的康熙字典解释

【亥集下】【龍字部】　龖； 康熙笔画：32； 页码：页1537第20
【唐韻】徒合切【集韻】達合切，?音沓。【說文】飛龍也。　又【六書·精薀】震怖也。二龍?飛，威靈盛赫，見者氣奪，故讋从此省。【元包經】震龖之赫霆之砉。傳曰：二龍怒也。　又【集韻】悉合切，音趿。飛龍也。

龖字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
龖字的起名意思

指双龙或形容龙腾飞的样子。

Shan
Basic explanation of words
Shan
dá
Ssangyong: "Shan Zhi He, Ting Zhi Piao."
The look of dragon flying.
Shan
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［dá］
["Guangyun" is only close together, enters together, and settles. ]
Also known as "龘1".
Two dragons.
Shan
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Hai Ji 2] [Dragon Character Department] 　龖; Kangxi Strokes: 32; Page Number: Page 1537 No. 20
[Tang Yun] Only fit and cut [Jiyun] to reach fit and cut,? Sound. [Said the text] Flying dragon too.　[Six Books·Jingxu] Shocking too. The two dragons fly, the spirit of prosperity, and the anger of those who see it, so Chen has never been here. [Yuan Bao Jing] Zhen Xi's He Ting's Pit. Chuan said: Erlong is also angry.　[Jiyun] The sound is singularly close. Flying dragon too.
Shan

Name meaning
Refers to Ssangyong or describes the appearance of a dragon taking off.
